'''Mukūmu''' is a character in {{poe2}}.

## Background

{{Description|A young warrior's forehead is furrowed with lines and beaded with perspiration. He stands over a man bound to a pole.}}
Mukūmu is trying to force [Tamau](/tamau/) to reveal where he has stashed the food that he allegedly stole. This is no small matter for the Tikawara tribe, as it was the last of the koiki, which was intended to be used in a religious ceremony to ensure a good harvest.

## Interactions

{{Interactions
|companion       =
|wares           =
|stronghold      =
|rest            =
|quests_started  = [Plucked Fruit](/pluckedFruit/)
|quests_involved =
|none            = 
|other           =
}}

## =Quests

=
* [Plucked Fruit](/pluckedFruit/): Mukumu asks that you recover the lost fruit and ensure that the ceremony can move forward.
[Category:Tikawara characters](/categoryTikawaraCharacters/)
